SENT.plain: Life-threatening infection after the extraction of the right maxillary and mandibular third molars, and the minimal early treatment of the ensuing complications, has been described
Perhaps, if proper incision and drainage and adequate antibiotic treatment had been instituted immediately after extraction, the ensuing complications could have been avoided
There will never be total agreement regarding the optimal time to surgically remove a tooth
The latter is based on individual preferences, past experiences, and clinical successes of the practitioner
However, if extraction is decided on, the surgeon must be able to recognize the early development of complications and institute appropriate treatment
